DOCNAME: CASE OF GROSSMANN AIR SERVICE BEDARFSLUFTFAHRTUNTERNEHMEN GMBH & CO KG v. AUSTRIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
JUDGES: Egidijus Kūris;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Gabriele Kucsko-Stadlmayer
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company is a limited liability company which is registered in GPE and has its seat in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the ORG Minister made a public call for tenders concerning flight services for delegations of ORG . The applicant company submitted an offer , but simultaneously complained that the public tender was tailored towards CARDINAL specific tenderer , namely the L. company . It was therefore revoked .
CARDINAL . On DATE an amended public call for tenders was issued . The applicant company did not submit an offer .
CARDINAL . Upon request , the applicant company was informed that ORG decided on DATE to award the contract to the L. company . The respective contract was concluded on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , received by ORG ( Bundesvergabeamt ) on DATE , the applicant company requested to initiate review proceedings concerning the public call for tenders and to declare the awarding of the contract to the L. company null and void .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant company ’s request , holding that it had failed to show its legal interest in the public tender .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company filed a complaint with ORG and asked it to seek a preliminary ruling from ORG of ORG ( CJEU ) on the question of the existence of a legal interest .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set aside ORG decision and held that it should have requested a preliminary ruling .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG therefore requested a preliminary ruling from the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued a preliminary ruling , holding in essence that a person who did not participate in the public tendering proceedings due to an allegedly discriminatory call may still request their review .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again rejected the applicant company ’s request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company filed a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declined to deal with the applicant company ’s complaint , holding that it did not raise any questions of constitutional law , and transferred the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted its amended complaint to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set aside ORG decision , holding that the applicant company had been eligible to file a request for review proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company filed a letter to the ORG ’s Department ( GPE ) , asking whether GPE would be interested in reaching a settlement in this case , referring to ORG inactivity after ORG last decision and the fact that the proceedings have already lasted for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Auditor - General ’s Department replied and requested the applicant company to specify their claims for compensation . It further stated that the applicant company could file an application against ORG failure to decide .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company filed an application with ORG against ORG failure to decide ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG to issue , within DATE , either a decision or to explain why it did not violate its duty to decide .
CARDINAL . On DATE a meeting took place between the parties , but no settlement could be reached .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued its decision , finding that awarding the contract to the L. company in the public tender proceedings had not been unlawful .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings concerning the applicant company ’s application filed against ORG failure to decide as the latter had issued its decision on DATE , but awarded the applicant company the legal costs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company filed a complaint with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declined to deal with the complaint . It held that the impugned decision had not deviated from ORG case - law and that the complaint did not raise any legal questions of fundamental significance .
CARDINAL . NORP This decision was served on the applicant company ’s counsel on DATE .
